segment.source: Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode
segment.target: Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode

segment.source: Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode
segment.target: Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode

segment.source: Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode
segment.target: Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode

segment.source: You can use an answer file to automate the installation of device drivers when the computer is booted in audit mode.
segment.target: You can use an answer file to automate the installation of device drivers when the computer is booted in audit mode.

segment.source: Adding a Device Driver
segment.target: Adding a Device Driver

segment.source: The auditSystem configuration pass processes unattended Setup settings while Windows is running in system context, before a user logs on to the computer in audit mode.
segment.target: The auditSystem configuration pass processes unattended Setup settings while Windows is running in system context, before a user logs on to the computer in audit mode.

segment.source: The auditSystem configuration pass runs only if the computer is booted in audit mode.
segment.target: The auditSystem configuration pass runs only if the computer is booted in audit mode.

segment.source: To add device drivers during the auditSystem configuration pass, add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component to your answer file in the auditSystem configuration pass, and specify the path for each device driver.
segment.target: To add device drivers during the auditSystem configuration pass, add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component to your answer file in the auditSystem configuration pass, and specify the path for each device driver.

segment.source: After you run Setup, boot Windows in audit mode.
segment.target: After you run Setup, boot Windows in audit mode.

segment.source: You can run the Sysprep command with the /audit option to configure the computer to start in audit mode the next time that it boots.
segment.target: You can run the Sysprep command with the /audit option to configure the computer to start in audit mode the next time that it boots.

segment.source: Or, in the answer file, you can configure the Microsoft-Windows-DeploymentReseal setting to audit.
segment.target: Or, in the answer file, you can configure the Microsoft-Windows-DeploymentReseal setting to audit.

segment.source: For more information, see Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
segment.target: For more information, see Unattended Windows Setup Reference.

segment.source: To add a device driver during the auditSystem configuration pass
segment.target: To add a device driver during the auditSystem configuration pass

segment.source: Locate the .inf files that you want to install during audit mode for the device driver.
segment.target: Locate the .inf files that you want to install during audit mode for the device driver.

segment.source: On your technician computer, open Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).
segment.target: On your technician computer, open Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).

segment.source: Click Start, type Windows System Image Manager, and then select Windows System Image Manager.
segment.target: Click Start, type Windows System Image Manager, and then select Windows System Image Manager.

segment.source: Open your answer file and expand the Components node to display available settings.
segment.target: Open your answer file and expand the Components node to display available settings.

segment.source: Add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component to your answer file in the auditSystem configuration pass.
segment.target: Add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component to your answer file in the auditSystem configuration pass.

segment.source: Expand the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE node in the answer file.
segment.target: Expand the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE node in the answer file.

segment.source: Right-click DevicePaths, and then click Insert New PathAndCredentials.
segment.target: Right-click DevicePaths, and then click Insert New PathAndCredentials.

segment.source: A new PathAndCredentials list item appears.
segment.target: A new PathAndCredentials list item appears.

segment.source: For each location that you access, add a separate PathAndCredentials list item.
segment.target: For each location that you access, add a separate PathAndCredentials list item.

segment.source: In the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component, specify the path of the device driver and the credentials that are used to access the file if the file is on a network share.
segment.target: In the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component, specify the path of the device driver and the credentials that are used to access the file if the file is on a network share.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can include multiple device-driver paths by adding multiple PathAndCredentials list items.
segment.target: You can include multiple device-driver paths by adding multiple PathAndCredentials list items.

segment.source: If you add multiple list items, you must increment the value of for each path.
segment.target: If you add multiple list items, you must increment the value of for each path.

segment.source: For example, if you add two separate driver paths, the first path uses the value of 1, and the second path uses the value of 2.
segment.target: For example, if you add two separate driver paths, the first path uses the value of 1, and the second path uses the value of 2.

segment.source: Save the answer file and close Windows SIM.
segment.target: Save the answer file and close Windows SIM.

segment.source: The answer file must resemble this example:
segment.target: The answer file must resemble this example:

segment.source: Boot in Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), run Windows Setup, and specify the name of the answer file.
segment.target: Boot in Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), run Windows Setup, and specify the name of the answer file.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: The specified answer file is cached to the system so that when you run audit mode, the computer applies settings in the answer file.
segment.target: The specified answer file is cached to the system so that when you run audit mode, the computer applies settings in the answer file.

segment.source: Setup finishes.
segment.target: Setup finishes.

segment.source: Run the Sysprep command with the /audit option to configure the computer to start in audit mode the next time that it boots.
segment.target: Run the Sysprep command with the /audit option to configure the computer to start in audit mode the next time that it boots.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: When Windows reboots in audit mode, device drivers that you specified in the answer file are added.
segment.target: When Windows reboots in audit mode, device drivers that you specified in the answer file are added.

segment.source: You can use the PNPUtil tool to add, remove, and enumerate drivers on a running operating system.
segment.target: You can use the PNPUtil tool to add, remove, and enumerate drivers on a running operating system.

segment.source: For more information about how to use PNPUtil to add or remove Plug and Play drivers, see Install a Plug and Play Device.
segment.target: For more information about how to use PNPUtil to add or remove Plug and Play drivers, see Install a Plug and Play Device.
